text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically asks the model to analyze whether the principle of unreasonable non-disclosure under Schedule 3, paragraph 2(b) of the Land Registration Act 2002 applies, focusing on whether the occupier failed to disclose their interest when they reasonably could have been expected to do so. The candidate answer discusses general tenancy rights, eviction procedures, and the status of the occupier (tenant vs. licensee). It mentions ignoring the buyer's message, which is related to disclosure, but it fails to explicitly analyze or apply the specific legal test derived from Schedule 3, paragraph 2(b) of the LRA 2002 regarding 'unreasonable non-disclosure' in the context of overriding interests upon sale of registered land. Therefore, the criterion is not satisfied.", "criterion_id": "ff667083-8301-4791-98b8-3c393f9d217a"}
